subject: Re: [junit] What is the equivalent of TestRunner in JUnit 3.8
msgSnippet: Typically in junit 3.8, you have to write a subclass of TestCase where you can overwrite some methods.  The test classes will then have to extend your class

Typically in junit 3.8, you have to write a subclass of TestCase where you
can overwrite some methods.  The test classes will then have to extend your
class instead of using @RunWith(....).

Gilles Scokart


2009/2/23 kartik_krishnanand <kartik_krishnanand@...>

>   Hi,
>
> I have been using JUnit 4.x on my previous project. Now I have changed
> companies and projects where the development team uses JUnit 3.8. Is
> there a test runner equivalent that I can use?
>
> If not, is there a way I can create something like a test runner in
> JUNit 3.8.
>
> Please let me know. Any help would be appreciated.
>
> Thanks,
>
> Kartik
>
>  
>
